intro: Lavandula stoechas var. leucantha, commonly known as the white lavender or white flowering lavender, is a cultivar of the lavender plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its striking white flowers, which contrast with its gray-green foliage. This variety is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and its pleasant, aromatic fragrance. It prefers well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens or borders. The plant is also valued for its medicinal properties, similar to other lavender species.
